dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 723 IH: Protect American Election Administration Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cole (for himself, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Ellzey, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Zinke, Mr. Carter of Texas, and Mr. Mann) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit a State from receiving or using funds or certain donations from private entities for the administration of an election for Federal office, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect American Election Administration Act of 2025.

section.header: Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities

subsection.text: Title III of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21081 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating sections 305 and 306 as sections 306 and 307, respectively; and
by inserting after section 304 the following new section:

section.header: Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities for election administration

subsection.text: A State may not solicit, receive, or expend any payment or donation of funds, property, or personal services from a private entity for the purpose of the administration of an election for Federal office, including any programs with respect to voter education, voter outreach, and voter registration.
This section shall not apply with respect to the acceptance and use by a State of a donation from a private entity of space to be used for a polling place or an early voting site in the State.
Section 401 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21111) is amended by striking 303, and 304 and inserting 303, 304, and 305.
The table of contents of such Act is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating the items relating to sections 305 and 306 as relating to sections 306 and 307, respectively; and
by inserting after the item relating to section 304 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 305. Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities for election administration.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply with respect to any election for Federal office held after the date of the enactment of this Act.
